trans-unit.source: Draws a glyph at the top-most Z order position on an activity designer.
> [!NOTE] > [!INCLUDE[DeprecatedContent](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] The DesignerGlyph class is the base class for all designer glyphs used on a workflow design surface.
Activity designer developers can use classes that inherit from DesignerGlyph to draw custom glyphs onto the surface of an <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner>.

DesignerGlyph classes draw such glyphs at the top-level Z order, which places the custom glyph visually on top of all other glyphs on the designer based on the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerGlyph.Priority%2A> value of the custom glyph.

A lower value for the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerGlyph.Priority%2A> property indicates a higher priority and therefore draws the glyph at the top-most Z order position on an activity designer.
When implemented in a derived class, initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerGlyph"></xref> class.

Gets a value indicating whether the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerGlyph"></xref> can gain focus on the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner"></xref> with which it is associated.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the designer glyph can be activated; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Returns the bounds for the glyph on the specified <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner"></xref>.
Unless overridden in a derived class, GetBounds returns the bounds of the activity designer with which the glyph is associated.
The <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner"></xref> with which the glyph is associated.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> to indicate whether the glyph appears on the activity designer surface; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> that represents the bounds for the glyph.
designer contains a null reference ( in Visual Basic).
Represents the highest priority possible for a <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerGlyph"></xref>.
This value is a constant.

A lower value for the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerGlyph.Priority%2A> property indicates a higher priority and therefore draws the glyph at the top-most Z order position on an activity designer.
The value of the HighestPriority field is 0.
> [!NOTE] > This constant value serves as a guideline when creating custom glyphs.
You are free to use different values for the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerGlyph.Priority%2A> property when designing your custom glyph.
To be added.
Represents the lowest priority possible for a <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerGlyph"></xref>.
This value is a constant.

A high value for the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerGlyph.Priority%2A> property indicates a lower priority and therefore draws the glyph at the bottom-most Z order position on an activity designer.
The value of the LowestPriority field is 1000000.
> [!NOTE] > This constant value serves as a guideline when creating custom glyphs.
You are free to use different values for the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerGlyph.Priority%2A> property when designing your custom glyph.
To be added.
Represents the normal priority for a <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerGlyph"></xref>.
This value is a constant.
A lower value for the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerGlyph.Priority%2A> property indicates a higher priority whereas a higher value indicates a lower priority.
The value of the NormalPriority field is 10000.
> [!NOTE] > This constant value serves as a guideline when creating custom glyphs.
You are free to use different values for the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerGlyph.Priority%2A> property when designing your custom glyph.
To be added.
Indicates to the glyph that an action has been performed which has activated the glyph.
The <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner"></xref> on which the glyph is drawn.
When overridden in a derived class, performs any tasks required to render the glyph on the activity designer surface.

OnPaint uses <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.AmbientTheme.CommentIndicatorPen%2A> to draw the bounds of the comment glyph and <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.AmbientTheme.CommentIndicatorBrush%2A> to fill it.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Graphics"></xref> to perform fill and drawing tasks.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> to indicate that the glyph appears on the design surface; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.AmbientTheme"></xref> to use to access ambient property settings.
The <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner"></xref> from which to obtain information about user actions.
Gets the priority setting for the designer glyph on the activity design surface.
An integer value that represents the priority setting for the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerGlyph"></xref> on the activity designer surface.
A lower value indicates a higher priority and therefore draws the glyph at the top-most Z order position on an activity designer.
